post_title: STIB Abonnement for journeys to Airport?

comments.author: abysmalbutterfly
comments.body:
No, unfortunately not. If you have to fly every few weeks, you can buy a Flex-pass where you have to use the number of selected tickets within 1 month. I wish they had something similar, but valid for a year.

Why do we have this ridiculous Diabolo fee? A great decision by our politicians to engage in a binding [contract till 2047](https://www.brusselstimes.com/235966/why-passengers-have-to-pay-extra-for-trains-to-brussels-airport), and asked a private company to build the tunnel. Which didn't change anything for those travelling to and from the Brussels city by the way. An estimate last year showed it already cost us around 1 billion. 

Instead of building this, they could have built the entire tram connection which was [promised in 2013](https://www.werkenaandering.be/en/werken-aan/openbaar-vervoer/luchthaventram) at a cost of 100 million â‚¬.

Seems like they'll finally start building the tram in 2025, with 2030 as an operational deadline. But who knows. /endrant

comments.author: Siegfriedevens
comments.body: For a ride TO the airport with bus 12, you can just get on with a normal Mobib card or single ticket at normal price. If you take the bus FROM the airport, it's a special ticket of around 8 euros I think. So I just use my normal Mobib yearly pass to go and a single ticket to come back. Round trip is then 10 euros, which is still more affordable than most other options.
